Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.server.lobby

Class Lobby

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.server.lobby.Lobby
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILobby, Service
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcreteLobby
public abstract class Lobby extends Object implements ILobby
a lobby contains all the relevant info for creating a game when the time is due (i.e., the desired number of players has been reached) the lobby behaviour is determined by its state

  • Constructor Details

    • Lobby

      protected Lobby(String gameID, int numberOfPlayers, TypeOfGame gameMode) throws InvalidArgsException
      creates a new lobby in a no game state
      Parameters:
      gameID - given game id
      numberOfPlayers - desired number of players
      gameMode - desire game mode
      Throws:
      InvalidArgsException - thrown when the number of desired players is none of the following: 2, 3 or 4

    • Lobby

      protected Lobby(String gameID)
      used for loading a lobby with the given gameID
      Parameters:
      gameID - gameID of the gameFile

  • Method Details

    • onAddPlayer

      public void onAddPlayer(Connection sender) throws ServerException
      Description copied from interface: ILobby
      a player wants to join
      Specified by:
      onAddPlayer in interface ILobby
      Parameters:
      sender - player who wants to join
      Throws:
      ServerException - thrown for a variety of reasons, but mostly because: - somebody with the same name is already inside the lobby - the lobby is full (i.e.: the game is currently on) - the game is in stand-by but the player is not an original player

    • onRemovePlayer

      a player wants to leave
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      public void onExecuteCommand(PlayerVisitorCommand command) throws ServerException
      Description copied from interface: ILobby
      a player wants to make a game move
      Specified by:
      onExecuteCommand in interface ILobby
      Parameters:
      command - command to execute
      Throws:
      ServerException - can be thrown for a variety of reasons, but mostly because the game has yet to start or is currently paused

    • executeGameCommand

      public void executeGameCommand(PlayerVisitorCommand command)
      executes the given game command, if an error occurs during computation it reloads the game to a previous save. This is safe because the last save is the game state just before the faulty command was sent.
      Parameters:
      command - command to execute

    • saveGameState

      public void saveGameState()
      saves the game state on disk

    • reloadGameState

      public void reloadGameState()
      reloads the game to its last game save
